workshop.internal.services

Class WorkshopEntitiesServiceAbstract<T extends WorkshopEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • workshop.internal.services.WorkshopEntitiesServiceAbstract<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class type of the Entity its instance will be serving to.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthorityPermissionsService, ClassifiersGroupsService, ClassifiersService, DepartmentsService, EmployeesService, ExternalAuthoritiesService, InternalAuthoritiesService, OrdersService, PhonesService, PositionsService, TasksService, UsersService, WorkshopEntityTypesService

    @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED)
 @Service
public abstract class WorkshopEntitiesServiceAbstract<T extends WorkshopEntity>
extends java.lang.Object
    Always returns ready-to-use WorkshopEntities or throws WorkshopExceptions for ExceptionHandlerController with appropriate HttpStatuses and localized messages for end-users. This class also intended to throw WorkshopException with fully localized messages with appropriate HttpStatus codes to be shown to the end Users.

                                                               throws EntityNotFoundException
        Parameters:

        propertyName - String with any existing WorkshopEntity property.
        propertyValue - String as the value of any existing WorkshopEntity property.
        Returns:
        List<WorkshopEntity> with the found WorkshopEntitys in it.
        Throws:

      • findById

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               readOnly=true,
               isolation=READ_COMMITTED)
public T findById(long id)
                                                                                                                          throws IllegalArgumentsException,
                                                                                                                                 EntityNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        id - WorkshopEntity ID
        Returns:
        A found Entity or throws EntityNotFoundException with appropriate HttpStatus and localized message for the end Users. That Exception is intended to be intercept by ExceptionHandler controller.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentsException - With appropriate HttpStatus and fully localized error message for the end users if the given parameter id is null either zero or below zero.
        EntityNotFoundException - If nothing was found. With appropriate HttpStatus and fully localized message for being intercepted by ExceptionHandlerController to be sent to the end users.

        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - In case of problems with the DataBase.
        EntityNotFoundException - If nothing was found.

      • persistOrMergeEntities

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public java.util.Collection<T> persistOrMergeEntities(T... entity)
                                                                                                                             throws IllegalArgumentsException,
                                                                                                                                    org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationCredentialsNotFoundException,
                                                                                                                                    PersistenceFailureException,
                                                                                                                                    EntityNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        entity - Array of Entities to be saved or persisted
        Returns:
        Collection of the managed Entities copies.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentsException - If an Entity == null, with localized message and HttpStatus.NOT_ACCEPTABLE
        org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationCredentialsNotFoundException - If this method is trying to be performed without an appropriate Authentication within the Spring's SecurityContext.
        PersistenceFailureException - If some properties of the given Entity are incorrect.
        EntityNotFoundException - If the given Entity.ID is not presented in the DataBase.

      • persistEntity

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public T persistEntity(T entity)
                                                                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                                     IllegalArgumentsException,
                                                                                                     javax.persistence.EntityExistsException,
                                                                                                     PersistenceFailureException
        Parameters:
        entity - WorkshopEntity instance. Has to have 'identifier' property == null or 0.
        Returns:
        Persisted and managed copy of a given WorkshopEntity with the Identifier.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentsException - with 422 HttpStatus.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY in a given WorkshopEntity is null!
        javax.persistence.EntityExistsException - If such a WorkshopEntity is already exists.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a given Entity is not an entity either is null or its identifier != 0
        PersistenceFailureException - 1) With 409 HttpStatus.CONFLICT in case of persistence failure. It may happen due to wrong properties. 2) With 422 HttpStatus.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY if its 'identifier' not null and greater than 0. As to be persisted Entities dont't have to have their own ids.

      • mergeEntity

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public T mergeEntity(T entity)
                                                                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                                   PersistenceFailureException
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to be merged (updated) in the DataBase
        Returns:
        An updated and managed copy of the given entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given entity == null or its id == null or id <= 0. As to be updated (merged) this WorkshopEntity has to be exist in the DataBase.
        PersistenceFailureException - If the given entity is in the removed state (not found in the DataBase) with 410 HttpStatus.GONE and the explicit localized message for the end User.

      • mergeEntities

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public java.util.Collection<T> mergeEntities(java.util.Collection<T> entities)
        Parameters:
        entities - persistEntities(Collection)
        Returns:
        A collection of only those entities which were able to be persisted. If the given collection doesn't exceed the WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract#getBatchSize() a collection of persisted and managed copy of entities will be returned. Otherwise the collection of detached entities will be returned (not to overload the memory and JPA first-level cache) and you will have to get entities from your collection yourself.

               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public java.util.Collection<T> mergeEntities(T... entities)
        Parameters:
        entities - persistEntities(Collection)
        Returns:
        A collection of only those entities which were able to be persisted. If the given collection doesn't exceed the WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract#getBatchSize() a collection of persisted and managed copy of entities will be returned. Otherwise the collection of detached entities will be returned (not to overload the memory and JPA first-level cache) and you will have to get entities from your collection yourself.

        id - Accepts only above zero values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentsException - If the given identifier <= 0 the 406 HttpStatus.NOT_ACCEPTABLE will be thrown with the explicit localized message to the end User.
        EntityNotFoundException - If no WorkshopEntity with such an ID will be found 404 NotFound Http status will be thrown.

      • persistEntities

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public java.util.Collection<T> persistEntities(java.util.Collection<T> entities)
        Parameters:
        entities - persistEntities(Collection)
        Returns:
        persistEntities(Collection) If the given collection doesn't exceed the WorkshopEntitiesDaoAbstract#getBatchSize() a collection of persisted and managed copy of entities will be returned. Otherwise an Collections.emptyList() will be returned (not to overload the memory and JPA first-level cache) and you will have to get entities from your collection yourself.

      • findAllEntities

        @Transactional(propagation=SUPPORTS,
               isolation=READ_COMMITTED,
               readOnly=true)
public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<T> findAllEntities(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
                                                                                                                                                                       throws InternalServerErrorException,
                                                                                                                                                                              EntityNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        pageable - If doesn't contain 'Sort' with property to be ordered by and Sort.Direction, DEFAULT_ORDER_BY with DEFAULT_ORDER will be used
        Returns:
        A Page with a collection of Entities or EntityNotFoundException will be thrown if nothing found or something went wrong during the search. The Page consists of number of pages, all the included pages parameters, total elements etc. to be processed for subsequent requests for all possible Pages.
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - If nothing was found or 'orderBy' property isn't presented among entityClass properties.
        InternalServerErrorException - If Pageable argument is null.

      • findAllEntities

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=READ_COMMITTED,
               readOnly=true)
public java.util.List<T> findAllEntities(int pageSize,
                                                                                                                                                        int pageNum,
                                                                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String orderBy,
                                                                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                                                                        org.springframework.data.domain.Sort.Direction order)
                                                                                                                                                 throws EntityNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        pageSize - min = 0 (will be set to MAX_PAGE_SIZE). In case of incorrect values the size will also be set in between 1 and max.
        pageNum - min = 0, max = MAX_PAGE_NUM. In case of incorrect values the page will be set in between min and max
        orderBy - If "default" or empty - a List will be ordered by CreationDate
        order - ENUM from Sort.Direction with "ASC" or "DESC" values
        Returns:
        List of Entities or throws EntityNotFoundException if either nothing was found or a PersistenceException occurred.
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - If nothing was found or entityClass doesn't have 'orderBy' property.

      • refreshEntity

        public void refreshEntity(T... entity)
        Works only with managed Entities! Refresh the state of the instance from the database, overwriting changes made to the entity, if any.

public boolean isExist(long id)

      • getVerifiedEntitiesPage

        protected org.springframework.data.domain.Page<T> getVerifiedEntitiesPage(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable,
                                                                          java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> entities)
                                                                   throws EntityNotFoundException
        Convenient method to receive a raw data from DAO and transform it to Page or throw localized EntityNotFoundException 1) Checks if a given Optional.List of Entities is present. If not - throws EntityNotFoundException, with the corresponds HttpStatus and localized message for the end-users. 2) Returns the fully prepared Page containing info about amount of Pages, total entities, current page num etc. to be extracted and user by WorkshopEntitiedResourceAssemblers.
        Parameters:
        pageable - PageRequest with verified parameters to prepare Page from.
        entities - Found WorkshopEntities collection from WorkshopEntitiesDao
        Returns:
        Page with number of pages, all the included pages parameters, total elements etc.
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - If no Entities were found.

      • getVerifiedEntitiesPage

        protected org.springframework.data.domain.Page<T> getVerifiedEntitiesPage(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable,
                                                                          java.util.Optional<java.util.List<T>> entities,
                                                                          java.lang.Long totalEntities)
                                                                   throws EntityNotFoundException
        Convenient method to receive a raw data from DAO and transform it to Page or throw localized EntityNotFoundException 1) Checks if a given Optional.List of Entities is present. If not - throws EntityNotFoundException, with the corresponds HttpStatus and localized message for the end-users. 2) Returns the fully prepared Page containing info about amount of Pages, total entities, current page num etc. to be extracted and user by WorkshopEntitiesResourceAssemblers.
        Parameters:
        pageable - PageRequest with verified parameters to prepare Page from.
        entities - Found WorkshopEntities collection from WorkshopEntitiesDao
        totalEntities - Predefined amount of total Entities to be set to the Page. It is useful when getting specific amount of Entities (e.g. all Positions by Department) when you previously count not all the Positions, but all the Positions by particular Department.
        Returns:
        Page with number of pages, all the included pages parameters, total elements etc.
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - If no Entities were found.

      • getEntityNotFoundException

        protected EntityNotFoundException getEntityNotFoundException(java.lang.String entityClassName)
        The convenient method to obtain a fully prepared EntityNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        entityClassName - A SimpleClassName to be inserted into the localized message.
        Throws:
        EntityNotFoundException - With 404 HttpStatus and fully localized message for the end users If no Entities were found.

      • getVerifiedAndCorrectedPageable

        protected org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable getVerifiedAndCorrectedPageable(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
                                                                            throws InternalServerErrorException
        Verifies Pageable to be consistent.
        Parameters:
        pageable - The Pageable to be checked and renewed if it is non-compatible with standards.
        Returns:
        Fully verified and renewed Pageable with corrected values.
        Throws:
        InternalServerErrorException - If Pageable to be verified is null;
